history.text: Hi! I can help you get an auto insurance quote. To get started, I'll need your VIN number.
Ugh, I'm at work right now. I don't have that on me.
No problem! You can usually find your VIN on your insurance card or registration document.
Great! To finalize your quote, I just need your vehicle identification number (VIN).
Where do I even find that? Is it on my car somewhere?
Yes! It's on the driver's side dashboard near the windshield, or on the driver's door jamb.
Ok let me go check... actually it's raining outside, can I do this later?
Almost done! I just need your driver's license number to complete the quote.
I don't have my wallet with me, it's in my other bag
No worries, you can also find it on any previous insurance documents you might have.
To verify your vehicle, please upload a photo of your car showing the license plate.
My car is parked in a garage at work, I can't get to it right now
That's okay! You can send the photo anytime today.
Perfect! Now I just need you to upload a photo of your current insurance card.
I have to dig through my glove box for that... this is a lot of work just for a quote
I understand! The insurance card helps us give you the most accurate rate comparison.
To add your spouse to the policy, I'll need their full legal name, date of birth, and social security number.
Whoa, SSN? I'm not comfortable sharing that over text
I completely understand your concern. We use bank-level encryption and your data is protected.
Would you like to add comprehensive coverage with a $500 deductible, or go with liability-only with UM/UIM?
Um what's UM/UIM? I don't understand all these terms
UM/UIM stands for Uninsured/Underinsured Motorist coverage. It protects you if you're hit by a driver without adequate insurance.
Please provide your garaging address if different from your primary residence for rating purposes.
Huh? What's a garaging address? I park in my driveway
A garaging address is where your car is primarily parked overnight. If that's your home, they're the same!
Your current policy has a 80/20 split with aggregate limits of 100/300/100. Want to keep those or adjust?
I literally have no idea what any of that means lol
Great! I've sent a DocuSign to your email. Please sign and return, then text DONE when complete.
Wait, I thought we were doing everything by text? Now I have to check email too?
Yes, for legal documents we use secure electronic signatures via email. It only takes a minute!
Hi! Ready to continue with your auto insurance quote?
Hey yeah give me like 10 min, in a meeting
No problem! Just text back when you're ready.
Your quote is $127/month. Would you like to proceed with this coverage?
Let me think about it and talk to my husband tonight
Of course! Take your time. This quote is valid for 30 days. Just text back when you're ready.
Based on your info, your monthly premium would be $145. Want me to break down the coverage details?
That's more than I'm paying now. Let me check a few other quotes first
Absolutely! Let me know if you have any questions or want to adjust coverage to lower the price.
What's your zip code?
Perfect! And what year is your vehicle?
Your new policy is active! Your ID cards have been emailed to you. Anything else I can help with?
Nope, thanks so much!
You're welcome! Drive safe, and don't hesitate to reach out if you need anything.
Thanks for your interest! Let's start with your VIN to get the most accurate quote.
I just bought the car, I don't even have the registration yet
Congratulations on the new car! You can find the VIN on the window sticker or purchase documents.
Those are all with the dealer still, picking up the car tomorrow
To include your teen driver, I'll need their license number and driving record.
She literally just got her license yesterday, there's no record
That's fine! I just need the license number then.
She's at school, I don't have it memorized
Would you like to add PIP coverage? It's required in your state with minimum $10k.
What is PIP? Never heard of it
PIP is Personal Injury Protection. It covers medical expenses regardless of who's at fault.
But I already have health insurance through work...
Almost there! Please upload photos of your car from 4 angles: front, back, left side, right side.
4 photos?? That seems excessive just to get a quote
I understand! The photos help us verify the condition and give you the best rate. You can take them all at once.
My phone storage is full, I can't take any pics right now
Great progress! Just a few more questions. What's your current insurance company?
Geico. Hey I gotta run, kids are home. Can we finish tomorrow?
Of course! I'll save your progress. Just text 'continue' tomorrow and we'll pick up right here.
Please reply with your preferred effective date in MM/DD/YYYY format.
January 15
I need the date in MM/DD/YYYY format. For example: 01/15/2026
That's what I said, January 15th. Why isn't it working?
For the best rate, I need your credit score range. Would you say it's Excellent (750+), Good (700-749), Fair (650-699), or Poor (below 650)?
I don't really know my credit score off the top of my head
No worries! A general estimate works. Have you checked your credit recently?
Not really, how do I even check that?

metadata.description: Sample transcripts for testing Pulse classification engine
